attributes.action: call a General Election so that the will of the majority of the people of the UK can be heard.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With the overwhelming defeat of the Labour party in the Nantwich and Crewe by-election, the Prime Minister and the Labour Government should consider their position and popularity among the UK population.

If this is truly indicative that the people of the UK no longer wish the current Government to continue, then they should have the right to express themselves democratically.

I believe that this by-election has demonstrated clearly that the UK public want a change of Government and that a General Election should be called to allow democracy to follow its natural course.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
